DataElement.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Q1 Past Month Usual Bedtime at Night Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated perception of the time they have usually gone to bed at night in the past month, using a 24 hour clock expressed as hour and minutes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Past Month Usual Bedtime at Night
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval._Before the present time._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._A question about an individual's usual bedtime at night.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Concepts.definition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Property.preferredName: Past Month Usual Bedtime at Night
Property.preferredDefinition: Before the present time.:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:A question about an individual's usual bedtime at night.

A question about an individual's usual bedtime at night.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PSQI:Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, Buysse DJ, Reynolds CF, Monk TH, Berman SR, Kupfer DJ. University of Pittsburgh, 1989.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for PRO-HRQoL as part of the Round 6 CRF Data Collection Standards. mc 4/30/15; released on 08/26/2015 ylu

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The hours and minutes of a 24 hour clock used to represent the time a person wakes up or goes to bed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: PSQI:Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, Buysse DJ, Reynolds CF, Monk TH, Berman SR, Kupfer DJ. University of Pittsburgh, 1989.
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for PRO-HRQoL as part of the Round 6 CRF Data Collection Standards. mc 4/28/15; released on 08/26/2015 ylu

ReferenceDocuments.name: During the past month, what t
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past month, what time have you usually gone to bed at night?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are available on the University of Pittsburg, Sleep Medicine Institute website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
